revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Linksys |model=WRV54G |revision=v1 |upc=745883556687 |asin=B0000AR8Z1 |manuf_country=Taiwan |is_manuf=No |manuf=Gemtek |manuf_model=WX5715 |manuf_rev=V0.1 |availability= |est_release_date=03/2004 |fcc_date=08/01/2003 |fcc_id=Q87-WRV54G |ic_id=3839A-WRV54G |pcb_id= |type=wireless router |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Intel XScale |cpu1_model=IXP425;FWIXP425AB; |cpu1_cspeed=266 |fla1=8 |fla1_brand=Intel |fla1_model=E28F640J3A-120 |ram1=32 |ram1_brand=Dynachips |ram1_model=D98SD12816AH-6 |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=Mini PCI |expansion_minipci_num=1 |jtag=yes,, 20-pin header,, J2 |serial=yes,, 9-pin header |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if=Mini PCI |wi1_chip1_brand=Intersil |wi1_chip1_model=ISL3880 |wi1_chip2_brand=Intersil |wi1_chip2_model=ISL3686A |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL, RP-SMA |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Kendin |sw_model=KS8995M |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=100M |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=00:12:17,00:1A:70 |oui_eth=00:12:17,00:1A:70 }} Additional FCC IDs of Q87-HGA7S-3 (Linksys HGA7S, high gain antenna) :and Q87-HGA5S-3 (Linksys HGA5S, high gain antenna) WRV54G v1 serial numbers appear to start with '''MEX0'''. :The default SSID may be '''linksys-g'''. OEM: [[Gemtek]] WX5715 (WX5715_V01) :The CPU is part FWIXP425AB. *{{WiFiCert|W001244|04/29/2004}} {{See also|Linksys WRV54G|Gemtek}} ===Links=== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=194273 Pictures on the '''DD-WRT''' forums] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Linksys_WRV54G On the '''DD-WRT''' forums] *[http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/linksys/wrv54g On the '''OpenWrt''' wiki] ===Serial=== :Serial Port Pinout On the WRV-54G board, the 9 pins look like: 
              -----
(ttyS1 TX) 1 | 0 o | 2  +3.3V
           3 | o o | 4  +3.3V
           5 | o o | 6  GND
(ttyS1 RX) 7 | o o | 8  GND
           9 | o   |
              -----
(I've renumbered the pins to the standard pin convention for these connectors) ===JTAG=== J2 is definitely JTAG. It is using the 20-pin standard ARM JTAG pin layout. :Pin 1 on this header is on the edge of the board, closest to the LED. Pinout: (from Intel) 
                c[] LED5
       +3.3V -- 1 o o 2 -- NC
       nTRST -- 3 o o 4 -- GND
         TDI -- 5 o o 6 -- GND
         TMS -- 7 o o 8 -- GND
         TCK -- 9 o o 10 - GND
         GND - 11 o o 12 - GND
         TDO - 13 o o 14 - GND
      nRESET - 15 o o 16 - GND
          NC - 17 o o 18 - GND
          NC - 19 o o 20 - GND
